item.title: Donations pour into Maryland nonprofits on #GivingTuesday
item.description:
Donations pour into Maryland nonprofits on #GivingTuesday

The Baltimore Dance Crews Project set an ambitious goal Tuesday: By posting step-by-step video tutorials, the fledgling group hoped to get 5,000 people dancing and raise $5,000. Brian Gerardo, the group's director, said momentum from #GivingTuesday brought them dozens of new followers on Facebook and Instagram, and put them on track toward raising the cash they need to offer after-school programs and workshops to more local children and teens.

item.title: Volunteers Place Wreaths At Arlington National Cemetery
item.description:
Volunteers Place Wreaths At Arlington National Cemetery

ARLINGTON, Va. (AP) - A nonprofit group says it has placed remembrance wreaths on the more than 240,000 headstones at Arlington National Cemetery. Wreaths Across America said in a statement that over 70,000 volunteers helped place the wreaths Saturday. The Maine-based group says the green wreaths, each with a red bow, are a gesture of gratitude.

item.title: Agencies Are Carving Out a Niche in Socially Responsible Marketing
item.description:
Agencies Are Carving Out a Niche in Socially Responsible Marketing

Millennials will rally behind causes they care about-and will stand behind a brand that does the same. As Omnicom Group's Cone Communications shows, 70 percent will spend more on brands that support causes-and with millennials representing $2.45 trillion in spending power, the subject of corporate social responsibility carries an unexpected level of clout.

item.title: The Eight Building Blocks of Strong Nonprofit Brands
item.description:
The Eight Building Blocks of Strong Nonprofit Brands

Editors' note: This article is from NPQ 's fall 2015 edition, "Making Things Work: Considerations in Nonprofit Strategy." To some, the very idea of nonprofit branding is a vulgar topic. No doubt, the nonprofit sector should be about mission, about performance, about excellence.
